title: The Very Hungry Caterpillar
description: Follows the progress of a hungry little caterpillar as he eats his way through a varied and very large quantity of food until, full at last, he forms a cocoon around himself and goes to sleep.
author: Eric Carle

title: Where the Wild Things Are
description: Max's wild adventure to the land of the Wild Things, where he is made king.
author: Maurice Sendak

title: Goodnight Moon
description: A little bunny bids goodnight to all the objects in his room before falling asleep.
author: Margaret Wise Brown

title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
description: Harry Potter's life is changed forever on his eleventh birthday when a giant named Hagrid appears and tells him he is a wizard.
author: J.K. Rowling

title: Charlotte's Web
description: A pig named Wilbur befriends a spider named Charlotte, who tries to save him from being slaughtered.
author: E.B. White

title: The Cat in the Hat
description: The Cat in the Hat is a children's book written and illustrated by Dr. Seuss. The story centers on a tall anthropomorphic cat who wears a red and white-striped hat and a red bow tie.
author: Dr. Seuss

title: Green Eggs and Ham
description: Sam-I-Am tries to convince the narrator to try green eggs and ham in this classic Dr. Seuss tale.
author: Dr. Seuss

title: The Giving Tree
description: A tale of a tree that loves a boy, and the boy's relationship with the tree as he grows older.
author: Shel Silverstein

title: The Polar Express
description: A young boy takes a magical train ride to the North Pole on Christmas Eve.
author: Chris Van Allsburg

title: Oh, the Places You'll Go!
description: Dr. Seuss's book about life's ups and downs and the adventures you will face.
author: Dr. Seuss

title: The Tale of Peter Rabbit
description: The story of a mischievous rabbit who disobeys his mother's orders and sneaks into Mr. McGregor's garden.
author: Beatrix Potter

title: Corduroy
description: A story about a teddy bear named Corduroy who goes on an adventure in a department store to find his missing button.
author: Don Freeman

title: Guess How Much I Love You
description: A sweet story about the bond between parent and child as they express their love for each other.
author: Sam McBratney

title: The Snowy Day
description: A story about a young boy named Peter who experiences the joys of a snowy day.
author: Ezra Jack Keats

title: Madeline
description: A story about a brave little girl named Madeline who lives in a boarding school in Paris.
author: Ludwig Bemelmans

title: The Lorax
description: The Lorax tells the story of the Once-ler, who causes environmental destruction and the Lorax, who speaks for the trees.
author: Dr. Seuss

title: The Gruffalo
description: A mouse tells a tale of a mythical creature called the Gruffalo to scare off his predators, only to encounter the real Gruffalo.
author: Julia Donaldson

title: The Rainbow Fish
description: The Rainbow Fish is a story about a beautiful fish who learns to share his most prized possession, his scales.
author: Marcus Pfister

title: Winnie-the-Pooh
description: Winnie-the-Pooh and his friends in the Hundred Acre Wood go on many adventures.
author: A. A. Milne

title: The Little Engine That Could
description: The classic story of the little engine who believes in itself and overcomes a big challenge.
author: Watty Piper

title: The Story of Ferdinand
description: A peaceful bull named Ferdinand who prefers to smell flowers than fight in bullfights.
author: Munro Leaf

title: If You Give a Mouse a Cookie
description: A tale of a boy who gives a mouse a cookie, leading to a series of funny and unexpected events.
author: Laura Numeroff

title: Stellaluna
description: A baby bat named Stellaluna is separated from her mother and taken in by a family of birds.
author: Janell Cannon

title: Alexander and the Terrible, Horrible, No Good, Very Bad Day
description: Alexander wakes up with gum in his hair and everything goes wrong from there.
author: Judith Viorst

title: Make Way for Ducklings
description: Mr. and Mrs. Mallard look for a place to raise their ducklings in Boston.
author: Robert McCloskey

title: The Secret Garden
description: An orphaned girl discovers a neglected garden and brings it back to life, transforming herself and those around her in the process.
author: Frances Hodgson Burnett

title: The Wind in the Willows
description: A tale of the adventures of Mole, Rat, Badger, and the impulsive Toad.
author: Kenneth Grahame

title: Pippi Longstocking
description: The adventures of a spunky, independent girl named Pippi who lives by herself with her horse and monkey.
author: Astrid Lindgren

title: Matilda
description: A brilliant little girl with extraordinary powers takes on her school's evil headmistress.
author: Roald Dahl

title: The BFG
description: Sophie befriends a giant who, unlike his peers, doesn't eat children.
author: Roald Dahl

title: James and the Giant Peach
description: A young boy escapes his miserable life and embarks on a fantastical journey inside a giant peach.
author: Roald Dahl

title: Charlie and the Chocolate Factory
description: Charlie Bucket finds a golden ticket and wins a tour of Willy Wonka's mysterious chocolate factory.
author: Roald Dahl

title: The Jungle Book
description: A collection of stories about Mowgli, a boy raised by wolves in the jungle.
author: Rudyard Kipling

title: Anne of Green Gables
description: An imaginative, talkative, red-haired orphan is adopted by a brother and sister.
author: L. M. Montgomery

title: The Little Prince
description: A young prince from a distant asteroid recounts his adventures to a stranded pilot in the Sahara Desert.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

title: Alice's Adventures in Wonderland
description: A girl named Alice falls through a rabbit hole into a fantasy world populated by peculiar creatures.
author: Lewis Carroll

title: Peter Pan
description: The adventures of Peter Pan, the boy who wouldn't grow up, and his friends in Neverland.
author: J. M. Barrie

title: Holes
description: A boy is sent to a brutal camp where he is forced to dig holes all day, uncovering a mystery in the process.
author: Louis Sachar

title: Bridge to Terabithia
description: Two children create a magical forest kingdom and experience friendship and loss.
author: Katherine Paterson

title: A Wrinkle in Time
description: Three children travel through time and space to rescue their father from an evil force.
author: Madeleine L'Engle

title: The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe
description: Four children enter the magical land of Narnia through a wardrobe and help Aslan defeat the White Witch.
author: C. S. Lewis

title: The Chronicles of Narnia: The Horse and His Boy
description: A boy and a talking horse flee from their life of servitude in Calormen and find adventure in Narnia.
author: C. S. Lewis

title: The Chronicles of Narnia: Prince Caspian
description: The Pevensie siblings return to Narnia to help Prince Caspian overthrow the tyrant King Miraz.
author: C. S. Lewis

title: The Chronicles of Narnia: The Silver Chair
description: Eustace Scrubb and Jill Pole are sent to Narnia to find the missing Prince Rilian.
author: C. S. Lewis

title: The Chronicles of Narnia: The Voyage of the Dawn Treader
description: Lucy and Edmund Pevensie return to Narnia with their cousin Eustace and join King Caspian on a sea voyage.
author: C. S. Lewis

title: The Chronicles of Narnia: The Last Battle
description: The final book in the Narnia series, where the last battle between good and evil takes place.
author: C. S. Lewis

title: Charlotte's Web
description: A pig named Wilbur befriends a spider named Charlotte, who tries to save him from being slaughtered.
author: E.B. White

title: Stuart Little
description: The adventures of a mouse named Stuart who is born into a human family.
author: E.B. White

title: Trumpet of the Swan
description: A mute swan named Louis learns to play the trumpet to express himself and win the love of a beautiful swan named Serena.
author: E.B. White

title: The Phantom Tollbooth
description: A boy named Milo enters a magical world through a mysterious tollbooth.
author: Norton Juster

title: Tuck Everlasting
description: A young girl named Winnie meets the Tuck family, who have drunk from a spring that grants eternal life.
author: Natalie Babbitt

title: Ella Enchanted
description: A girl named Ella is under a spell that forces her to obey any order given to her.
author: Gail Carson Levine

title: The Tale of Despereaux
description: A brave mouse named Despereaux rescues a princess and finds his own path in life.
author: Kate DiCamillo

title: Coraline
description: A young girl named Coraline discovers an alternate universe behind a hidden door in her new home.
author: Neil Gaiman

title: The Graveyard Book
description: A boy named Bod is raised by ghosts in a graveyard after his family is murdered.
author: Neil Gaiman

title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
description: Harry Potter discovers he is a wizard and attends Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.
author: J.K. Rowling

title: Goodnight Moon
description: A little rabbit says goodnight to all the familiar things in his room before falling asleep.
author: Margaret Wise Brown

title: Where the Wild Things Are
description: A young boy named Max sails away to a land inhabited by wild creatures.
author: Maurice Sendak

title: The Very Hungry Caterpillar
description: Follow the journey of a caterpillar as it eats its way through various foods before transforming into a butterfly.
author: Eric Carle

title: Green Eggs and Ham
description: Sam-I-Am tries to convince a skeptic to try green eggs and ham in various locations and circumstances.
author: Dr. Seuss

title: The Cat in the Hat
description: The mischievous Cat in the Hat visits Sally and her brother on a rainy day, bringing chaos and fun.
author: Dr. Seuss

title: Oh, the Places You'll Go!
description: Dr. Seuss's classic book about the journey of life, filled with ups and downs and endless possibilities.
author: Dr. Seuss

title: The Giving Tree
description: A touching story about the relationship between a boy and a tree that gives selflessly throughout his life.
author: Shel Silverstein

title: Curious George
description: Follow the adventures of Curious George, a mischievous monkey, and his friend, the Man in the Yellow Hat.
author: H.A. Rey and Margret Rey

title: Madeline
description: Madeline is the smallest and most adventurous of the twelve little girls who live in a boarding school in Paris.
author: Ludwig Bemelmans

title: The Polar Express
description: A magical train ride takes a young boy on a journey to the North Pole to meet Santa Claus.
author: Chris Van Allsburg

title: The Velveteen Rabbit
description: A toy rabbit longs to become real through the love of a young boy.
author: Margery Williams

title: Guess How Much I Love You
description: Little Nutbrown Hare and Big Nutbrown Hare express their love for each other in this heartwarming story.
author: Sam McBratney
